questiontext.text: Which of the following metabolites is the product of muscle energy metabolism and is used to measure the glomerular filtration rate?
Which of the following is the correct sequence of urine formation?

answer.text: Reabsorption à Ultrafiltration à Secretion
Ultrafiltration à Secretion à Reabsorption
Reabsorption à Secretion à Ultrafiltration
Secretion à Ultrafiltration à Reabsorption

questiontext.text: What happens to the pH in a patient who is hypoventilating?

answer.text: Increased CO2 will decrease H+ ions, thus decreasing pH, leading to respiratory alkalosis
Increased CO2 will increase H+ ions, thus decreasing pH, leading to respiratory acidosis
The pH becomes cyanotic
Increased CO2 will increase H+ ions, thus increasing pH, leading to respiratory acidosis
Decreased CO2 will increased H+ ions, thus increasing pH, leading to respiratory acidosis
